title: Banana Ripening
fact: Bananas release ethylene gas, which speeds up the ripening of nearby fruits. Store them separately if you don’t want other fruits to ripen quickly.

title: Storing Tomatoes
fact: Tomatoes should not be stored in the refrigerator, as it changes their texture and flavor. Keep them at room temperature.

title: Freezing Bread
fact: Bread lasts much longer if stored in the freezer. Slice it before freezing so you can take out only what you need.

title: Reviving Wilted Greens
fact: Soak wilted lettuce or spinach in a bowl of ice water for 5–10 minutes to make them crisp again.

title: Best Before vs Expiry
fact: ‘Best before’ indicates quality, not safety. Many foods are still safe to eat after the best before date if stored properly.

title: Leftover Rice Safety
fact: Cooked rice should be cooled quickly and refrigerated within 2 hours. Reheat thoroughly before eating to avoid bacteria growth.

title: Citrus Freshness
fact: Store lemons and limes in the fridge inside a sealed bag to keep them fresh for up to a month.

title: Milk Storage
fact: Milk lasts longer when stored on the middle shelves of the fridge, not in the door, where temperatures fluctuate more.
